level.text: All sidewalk Vending Locations shall be in accordance with the following standards:
Sidewalk Vending Locations shall only be located along streets within:
The Central Vending Zone;
Neighborhood Vending Zones;
The Old Georgetown Vending Zone; and
The Nationals Park Vending Zone.
No more than three (3) sidewalk Vending Locations shall be designated on any side of any city block;
No sidewalk Vending Location shall be designated:
In front of a predominately residential building outside the Central Vending Zone;
On the median strip of a divided roadway, unless the strip is intended for use as a pedestrian mall or plaza;
Along the length of a Metrobus Stop Zone, a commuter bus zone, an intercity bus zone, or other curbside zone specifically designated and demarcated as being for transit use;
In a location that is on or that impedes free access to service or ventilation grates or covers;
On a restricted street designated in § 526.3; or
Within any area under the exclusive jurisdiction of the United States Park Police, the United States Capitol Police, or any other agency of the United States government;
Within the Central Vending Zone, sidewalk vending shall be prohibited on sidewalks unless:
A ten foot (10 ft.) clear passageway is maintained;
The street is specifically exempted in § 526; or
The DDOT Director waives this restriction pursuant to § 525.2;
Outside the Central Vending Zone, sidewalk vending shall be prohibited on sidewalks unless:
A seven foot (7 ft.) clear passageway is maintained;
The sidewalk is specifically exempted in §§ 527, 528, or 529; or
The DDOT Director waives this restriction pursuant to § 525.2;
No sidewalk Vending Location shall be designated within:
Twenty feet (20 ft.) of the driveway entrance to a police or fire station;
Ten feet (10 ft.) of any other driveway;
Ten feet (10 ft.) of an alley;
Ten feet (10 ft.) of another sidewalk Vending Location;
Twenty feet (20 ft.) of the street-level entry to a Metrorail escalator;
Ten (10 ft.) of the street-level door to a Metrorail elevator;
A marked loading zone, entrance zone, or parking space designated for diplomatic parking, or other curbside location restricted for certain vehicles or uses;

One hundred feet (100 ft.) of the entrance to a District or federal courthouse, or within such greater distance as may be designated by the DDOT Director upon the written request of the courthouse administrator;
Ten feet (10 ft.) of a fire hydrant or in-ground fire stand pipe;
(11) Twelve feet (12 ft.) of any crosswalk when on the vehicle approach side of the Vending Location and crosswalk;
(12) Five feet (5 ft.) from any crosswalk when not on the vehicle approach side of the Vending Location and crosswalk; and
(13) Five feet (5 ft) from a building’s marked fire control room.

Upon the request of the DCRA Director, the DDOT Director may waive the minimum passageway requirement of §§ 525.1(d) or 525.1(e) if the DDOT Director determines there will not be an adverse impact on, among other things, pedestrian circulation and public safety. The DCRA Director shall note on the Vending Site Permit the issuance of the waiver by the DDOT Director.

The passageway required by §§ 525.1(d) and 525.1(e) shall be measured from the closest allowable projection of the vending cart or stand to the nearest building, private property line, or interruption of the public space by a public amenity or fixture, whichever is nearest.
